image.altText: Streaks of light are seen in a black night sky above a highway busy with cars

props.synopsis: Iran has fired several ballistic missiles at US military bases in Qatar, as the war in the region continues to expand. Follow live.

title.children: Trump declares ceasefire after missile strikes

image.altText: An aerial view of a collection of high-rise buildings, with a lake in the foreground and Telstra Tower in the background.

props.synopsis: Almost nine out of 10 blocks of land to be released for residential development across Canberra by 2030 will be for multi-unit housing — an announcement industry representatives say strikes the right balance for the future of housing.

title.children: Almost 90pc of new land releases in Canberra to be units

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: A man accused of sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl he met on a dating app has repeatedly denied he knew she was underage, telling the jury he thought she was a "petite 19-year-old".

title.children: Man accused of sexually assaulting 11yo tells jury he thought she was 19

image.altText: Woman and her dog at an RSPCA centre

props.synopsis: Shelters in the ACT are on the brink after cost of living pressures are causing deformed pups to be euthanised.

title.children: Backyard breeders on notice after 'deformed' puppies euthanised

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a baby pink scarf stands at the edge of an inland waterway smiling.

props.synopsis: When masters student Kinneret Pezarkar moved to Canberra from Mumbai, she found making friends a challenge despite being surrounded by other students who had left their support networks behind.

title.children: 'Persistent loneliness' in a city full of people looking for friends

image.altText: A man with short hair and a tshirt poses solemnly for a photo, with a pair of black sunglasses on the top of his head.

props.synopsis: In 2023, Clint Seares's partner Kerrie Carroll died by suicide the day after being discharged after a previous attempt. He is worried the system still has not changed.

title.children: Kerrie left hospital clutching medication. She died 36 hours later

image.altText: Two deep green marajuana leaf-shaped gummy lollies on a wire rack beside a white ruler, showing them to be roughly 4cm each.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old former Vietnamese student who sold cannabis gummies to Canberra schoolchildren and traded in illegal vapes, is jailed by the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: 'Jelly wobbles': Man jailed for selling cannabis gummies to children

image.altText: Leanne wears a winter coat and smiles standing outside.

props.synopsis: ACT Opposition Leader Leanne Castley says no "formal complaints" have been lodged within the Liberal team following MLA Peter Cain's resignation from her shadow cabinet over leadership concerns.

title.children: Castley says no warning before resignation, Cain insists he did

image.altText: A brain illustration with network pattern behind it in turquoise.

props.synopsis: AI is starting to take over the jobs of workers. But it's not the workers you might think.

title.children: Should we fear AI? It might just be the answer to productivity concerns

image.altText: Claire sifting through documents strewn on her living room floor.

props.synopsis: The lives of about 50,000 Australians are under the control of state-appointed guardians and trustees, but some are being used against them under a veil of intense secrecy.

title.children: Kayla's life was taken over by the government. She's gagged from speaking out

image.altText: A model of 3D printed oil barrels is seen in front of displayed stock graph going down in this illustration taken.

props.synopsis: US futures rise as Donald Trump flags a ceasefire deal between Israel and Iran. Earlier, Iran's retaliatory strikes were not seen as an escalation, leading to a drop in the price of Brent crude. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Oil price plunges after Iran does not target energy infrastructure

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: Trump says ceasefire deal reached between Israel and Iran

image.altText: An anonymous silhouette of a woman with curly hair as she stares out a window.

props.synopsis: Sarah says trying to get help from government support services for herself and her four young children has been "like talking to a brick wall".

title.children: Woman feared living in car with kids after NSW government decision

image.altText: A lightly browned pale slab sitting on a plate.

props.synopsis: Australia is among only a handful of countries around the world to have deemed it safe for sale, while several countries and US states have banned it.

title.children: 'Lab-grown meat' has been approved for sale in Australia. Will people eat it?

image.altText: Australia's Daria Kasatkina follows through after hitting a serve in windy conditions on a grass tennis court

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina's miserable build-up to Wimbledon continues with the Australian number one's defence of her Eastbourne title ending in the first round.

title.children: Aussie number one blown off course as Wimbledon looms

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Vololdymyr Zelenskyy about to hug on the steps of 10 Downing Street.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president says overnight strikes on Kyiv serve as a warning to other nations bordering Russia, Iran and North Korea, as he meets with the King and discusses security with the British prime minister.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls Russia, Iran and North Korea 'coalition of murderers' during UK visit

image.altText: gas fitter carries out service on gas water heater in Perth backyard

props.synopsis: From 2027, old gas hot water systems will be replaced with electric ones in homes under new reforms aimed at tackling emissions and gas shortages.

title.children: Gas is on the way out as Victoria continues push for all-electric homes

image.altText: Two people in a car.

props.synopsis: Finke Desert Race co-driver Bernie Webb says a safety mechanism kept him and his driver safe after they lost control at 160kph.

title.children: Desert racers release cabin video of high-speed, airborne crash

image.altText: Two orcas photographed from above - orcas pressed together kelp piece just visible between them.

props.synopsis: For the first time, researchers say they have captured footage of killer whales making tools out of seaweed to seemingly groom each other.

title.children: Scientists capture first evidence of orcas using seaweed to make tools

image.altText: Young violinist Chloe Chua in a black and white gown performing in front of the Singapore Symphony Orchestra in Sydney.

props.synopsis: From Geoffrey Tozer to child prodigies today, audiences are fascinated by young performers. We ask how these musicians balance their passion with other interests.

title.children: Child prodigies speak about the importance of just being kids

image.altText: A long table covered with packages leads to a group of people in orange prison uniforms

props.synopsis: Local police have arrested nearly 300 people in recent months for alleged drug offences, but have singled out women in a warning about forming relationships that could see them mixed up in crime.

title.children: Indonesian women urged to be more 'vigilant' after drug crackdown

image.altText: A woman wearing a raincoat stands in a forested setting.

props.synopsis: Well-versed viewers will find similarities with rom-coms like Bridget Jones and Notting Hill in this sweet yet strange rom-com that keeps you guessing.

title.children: Jane Austen rom-com makes cheeky nods to Bridget Jones, Hugh Grant

image.altText: brown cows stand in a pen

props.synopsis: The federal government revises the feedlot industry's contribution to greenhouse gas emissions after adopting a new equation to calculate methane from grain-fed cattle burps.

title.children: Grain-fed cattle's 'burp' emissions lower than previously thought

image.altText: India's Karun Nair walks off the field after losing his wicket as England players converge behind him in celebration

props.synopsis: Another India lower-order collapse gives England a fighting chance of a thrilling victory in the first Test at Headingley, with the hosts 0-21 in their second innings at the close of play on day four, chasing 371 to win.

title.children: India batting collapse gives England hope of dramatic Test win

image.altText: Bull dog Hank sitting on the grass, with green dense bushes behind him and the sun shining in the sky.

props.synopsis: Hank the Tank is believed to have spent 30 days lost in chilly, dense Victorian bushland before making his way back home.

title.children: Beloved pet bulldog survives month lost in Gippsland bush

image.altText: A crystal blue beach with a boat by the beach.

props.synopsis: Only students, medical patients and people purchasing essential goods will be allowed to enter or leave Thailand under the new rules.

title.children: Tourists blocked from crossing from Thailand to Cambodia

image.altText: A basin at a low level of water

props.synopsis: In a bid to conserve water, authorities across the state have been forced to move to very unusual winter restrictions.

title.children: Winter water restrictions turned on for three Victorian regions

image.altText: Firefighters standing in front of large flames beside a road.

props.synopsis: At least 190 extra firefighters are being deployed to the Aegean island as authorities predict heatwave condition to take hold in coming days.

title.children: Greek island declares 'state of emergency' as strong winds fan wildfires

image.altText: A sign outside the Flinders Medical Centre.

props.synopsis: A Flinders Medical Centre patient allegedly "launched" at a police officer and tried to grab the officer's gun in an incident the state's doctors' union says left medical staff "clearly shaken and worried".

title.children: 'Near miss': Patient allegedly reached for police gun at SA hospital

image.altText: A generic image of three police officers wearing the blue NSW officer uniform.

props.synopsis: A senior NSW Police officer has been found guilty of serious misconduct after he ignored an Aboriginal man self-harming while in custody, the police watchdog found.

title.children: 'Unconscious racism' drove police officer to ignore Aboriginal man self-harming

image.altText: Pink and blue glowing cloud against a backdrop of orange stars.

props.synopsis: A stunning nebula and a sky dotted full of stars and galaxies are in a set of three images released by the Vera C. Rubin Observatory as a taster of more to come.

title.children: First images of space from world's biggest digital camera stun astronomers

image.altText: Police and fire and rescue stand around a smashed up car on a tow truck.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are searching for two teenagers they believe were involved in a collision that killed a woman and an unborn baby.

title.children: Horror weekend on NSW roads as national toll hits 15-year high

image.altText: Queensland Parliament House in Brisbane looking through front fence with the top of the Executive Annexe in the background.

props.synopsis: The record funding will be announced when Treasurer David Janetzki on Tuesday hands down the state government's first budget since its election win in October.

title.children: Queensland government to spend more than $33 billion on public health next year

image.altText: Close up aerials West Metro Parramatta

props.synopsis: Work on the metro line linking Parramatta to the Sydney CBD started two years ago, but has been on pause for the past few weeks.

title.children: Digging restarts at Sydney Metro West after concerns it could damage building

image.altText: A football player.

props.synopsis: Josh Hill is set to face trial over allegations he indecently dealt with a teenager at the height of his AFL career.

title.children: Former Eagle, Western Bulldog denies alleged child sex assaults

image.altText: GettyImages-2220804928

props.synopsis: As Minjee Lee won her historic third major, a mention of her golfing brother highlighted the tyranny of distance between the two Australian stars.

title.children: The family message that stood out as Minjee Lee created golf history
